text: A dog was walking down a river carrying a tasty piece of meat in his nose. He saw his own reflection in the river water and believed that that reflection was actually another dog carrying a piece of meat larger than his own. And desiring to take possession of another's piece, he let go of his own to snatch the piece from his supposed partner. But the result was that he was left without his own and without the other: one because it did not exist, it was only a reflection, and the other, the real one, because it was carried away by the current. Better a bird in the hand than a hundred flying.
title: El perro y el reflejo en el río
author: nan Esopo
